Class ClientFilter

                      • io.buji.pac4j.ClientFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.servlet.Filter, org.apache.shiro.util.Nameable, org.apache.shiro.web.filter.PathConfigProcessor

    public class ClientFilter
extends org.apache.shiro.web.filter.authc.AuthenticatingFilter
    This filter retrieves credentials after a user authenticates at the provider to create an ClientToken to finish the authentication process and retrieve the user profile.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Jerome Leleu

      • createToken

        protected org.apache.shiro.authc.AuthenticationToken createToken(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request,
                                                     javax.servlet.ServletResponse response)
                                                          throws Exception
        The token created for this authentication is a ClientToken containing the credentials received after authentication at the provider. These information are received on the callback url (on which the filter must be configured).
        Specified by:
        createToken in class org.apache.shiro.web.filter.authc.AuthenticatingFilter
        Parameters:
        request - the incoming request
        response - the outgoing response
        Throws:
        Exception - if there is an error processing the request.

      • isAccessAllowed

        protected boolean isAccessAllowed(javax.servlet.ServletRequest request,
                      javax.servlet.ServletResponse response,
                      Object mappedValue)

      • getRedirectAfterSuccessfulAuthentication

        public boolean getRedirectAfterSuccessfulAuthentication()
        This redirectAfterSuccessfulAuthentication property controls the behaviour of the filter after successful login. If redirection is enabled (default) the filter will redirect the request to original requested url. In case redirection is disabled the filter will allow the request to passthrough the filter chain. This is useful for cas proxy (proxied application) where the credential receptor url is same as the resource url.
        Returns:
        current value of the property

      • setRedirectAfterSuccessfulAuthentication

        public void setRedirectAfterSuccessfulAuthentication(boolean casPassThrough)
